comments.body: would it be really hard to make it use `latestReleaseBranch` instead of having to do this part every release?

I was thinking the same.  We update cmd/mungedocs/mungedocs.go with sed to change the `latestReleaseBranch` and run this entirely heavyweight process to basically do what sed could have done directly on these .md files?  I guess it's doing much more?  
Why isn't `latestReleaseBranch` just taken from a check of the local repo or a call to github?

This is probably discussion for another Issue/PR though.  This change needs to get in, yes?

Is there an 'owner' for cmd/mungedocs at this point?
There is no real owner of cmd/mungedocs. It also needs to be moved to contrib so we can also run it on the doc repo

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +100,104 @@<strong>
The latest release of this document can be found
[here](http://releases.k8s.io/release-1.2/filename.md).

Documentation for other releases can be found at
